private_information: I am responsible for the left peg
Peg contents top->bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
left_agent.goal: Assist to move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I am responsible for the middle peg
middle_agent.goal: Assist to move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I am responsible for the right peg
right_agent.goal: Assist to move all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the Fast Downward solver to move the entire stack from the left peg to the right peg under the standard Tower of Hanoi rules.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are seven disks labeled A (smallest) through G (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initially the left peg has the disks top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G and the middle and right pegs are empty.
The goal is to have the right peg contain the disks top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G and the left and middle pegs empty.

report.system_prompt: You are a peg agent responsible for reporting the precise local state of your peg. Provide a compact machine-readable description of the disks on your peg and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is left_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->left_agent->private_information} Provide a concise description of your local peg state, list the disks from top to bottom, and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from the left peg considering the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are a peg agent responsible for reporting the precise local state of your peg. Provide a compact machine-readable description of the disks on your peg and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->middle_agent->private_information} Provide a concise description of your local peg state, list the disks from top to bottom, and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from the middle peg considering the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are a peg agent responsible for reporting the precise local state of your peg. Provide a compact machine-readable description of the disks on your peg and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from this peg given the Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Your name is right_agent. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->right_agent->private_information} Provide a concise description of your local peg state, list the disks from top to bottom, and enumerate the legal single-disk moves that originate from the right peg considering the rules. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling for classical planners and specifically target the Fast Downward solver. Using the reports from the peg agents and the public information, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance. The PDDL must be compatible with Fast Downward. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the local state reports from the three peg agents: {state_left} {state_middle} {state_right} Use these reports together with the public information: {environment->public_information} and the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} to produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the Fast Downward planner. The domain should define objects for pegs and disks, a predicate for disk ordering and disk-on-peg relations, and actions to move a single top disk between pegs while enforcing the size constraint. The problem should declare objects, the initial state reflecting the reports, and the goal state. Provide the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Think step by step and ensure the output is executable by Fast Downward.
